metadata.title: Ship of Opportunity - Canada to Australia, 1981-present
metadata.description: Data from merchant ships travelling between British Columbia and Australia, from 1981 to 1988 (Lillooet), 1997-1998 (Western Hawk), 1998-1999 (Australian Current), and 1999-2000, continuing (Packing). Data collected include total carbon dioxide, alkalinity(after 1997), nutrients, chlorophyll a (after 1997), carbon-13 in seawater, atmospheric carbon dioxide (PCO2), and atmospheric carbon-13. Underway measurements include position, time, temperature and salinity
keywords: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)
North Inner Coast (QCS, Hecate, Dixon Inlet and passages)
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Constructing models of Pacific Ocean carbon cycling; air-sea exchange, monitoring long term changes in the Pacific Ocean, tracking water masses in the ocean, El Nino monitoring

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre.
Risk of Loss: High
Impact Justification: Time series of 5 to 10 years
Impact of Loss: Medium
Recommended Action: Obtain access to data, bring data to archives

Status: In work

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: Private

Use constraints: Data will be available after it is quality checked and published.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Data quality - Logical consistency: Interlaboratory comparisons of nutrient and carbon-13 and oxygen-18 measurements; comparison to known standards. Salinometer calibrated with standard seawater. Fluorometer calibrated with commercially prepared standard or concentrated natural pigments.Nutrient standards compared to commercially prepared standards.
Data quality - Completeness: Electronic Data Complications: All of the magnetic tapes are older then their guaranteed physical lifespan.
Lineage - Process steps:
